keyword: how many calories are in a protein shake
title: How Many Calories Are in a Protein Shake?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in a protein shake, plus protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for your fitness goals.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Protein Shake?
assumptions: Standard whey protein shake: 1 scoop (30g) powder mixed with 250ml low-fat milk; no added fruits, sweeteners, or flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, protein type, liquid base, and add-ins. Check product labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A typical protein shake contains about 210 kcal and 33 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Mix with water instead of milk

faqs.q: How many calories are in a protein shake with milk?
faqs.a: About 210 kcal for a standard shake with low-fat milk.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a protein shake?
faqs.a: Typically 33 g per shake, depending on the scoop size and type.

faqs.q: Do protein shakes have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Around 14 g carbs per shake if using milk; less with water.

faqs.q: How does the base liquid affect calories in a protein shake?
faqs.a: Milk adds ~90 kcal; water or almond milk keeps it under 150 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie protein shake options?
faqs.a: Yes, isolate powders with water yield ~100-120 kcal; avoid sugary mixes.
